alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 3:35PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Henry, northwestern Clay and southern Quitman Counties through 415 PM EDT/315 PM CDT/... At 335 PM EDT/235 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Georgetown, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Days Crossroads, Wire Bridge, Walter F George Lake, Bonapartes Retreat, Standleys Store, Otho, Watson Crossroads, Double Bridges, Moores Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Pecan, Garnersville, Coates, Bagby State Park, Thomas Mill Creek, Hatcher, Morris and Cotton Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
